news.title: Over 2.6 lakh Hyderabad homes potential tinderboxes: Study
news.para: A recent study reveals that approximately 13 lakh Hyderabad residents in over 2.6 lakh households face a high risk of fire accidents, particularly in densely populated central and northeast zones. The research, highlighting over 4,000 structural fires since 2017, attributes the causes to electrical issues, careless smoking, and infrastructure vulnerabilities.

news.title: Karnataka Housing Board to acquire 315 acres near Kengeri for residential project
news.para: The Karnataka Housing Board (KHB) has initiated the acquisition of 315 acres in BM Kaval near Kengeri, Bengaluru, to address the housing needs of urban poor and middle-class families. This large-scale residential project aims to provide houses and plots for EWS, LIG, and MIG groups, leveraging the area's connectivity via Mysuru Road, NICE Road, and the Namma Metro.

news.title: Amid property tax row, Ghaziabad DM orders circle rate review
news.para: Ghaziabad's property prices may rise as the district administration reviews circle rates, potentially leading to revisions after a survey assessing market values. The stamp and registration department is gathering data to determine if a revision is justified, following a 15% increase in September 2024.

news.title: VMRDA approves 50-storey residential towers in Visakhapatnam
news.para: The Visakhapatnam Metropolitan Region Development Authority (VMRDA) has approved an iconic residential apartment project featuring six 50-storey towers in Madhurawada, offering 3, 4, and 4 BHK duplex apartments with high-end amenities. Additionally, VMRDA will develop middle-income group (MIG) housing projects across the city with 2, 2.5, and 3 BHK flats at subsidized rates.

news.title: Oriental Trimex to divest land assets, granite unit to streamline operations
news.para: Oriental Trimex will sell land and a granite unit in Odisha. This will streamline operations and boost liquidity. The company will begin quarry operations at its Black Granite mine soon. They received a mining lease from the Odisha government in May. A new "smart cut" machine will reduce waste.

news.title: Debock Industries' owner was investing proceed of crime in real estate: ED
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) uncovered a financial fraud exceeding Rs 100 crore by Debock Industries Ltd, whose owner was investing the illicit proceeds in real estate ventures, including resorts for destination weddings near Chaksu.

news.title: Chandigarh’s housing crunch: A city running out of room and time
news.para: Chandigarh, once a model city, now faces a severe housing shortage due to limited land and a growing population. With minimal land left for residential development, owning a home is becoming increasingly difficult. High demand and soaring prices exacerbate the problem, while government housing plans further reduce options for the general public, highlighting a shift in priorities.

news.title: Not under investigations, matter relates to India Cements: UltraTech on CCI direction
news.para: UltraTech Cement clarifies it is not under investigation by the Competition Commission of India regarding ONGC tenders. However, its subsidiary, India Cements Limited, is a party to the case and is exploring legal options. India Cements is assessing its options after receiving an investigation report.

news.title: Lenders reject Jaypee Infratech's request to accept its bid to acquire bankrupt firm
news.para: Lenders of Jaiprakash Associates Ltd (JAL) have rejected Jaypee Infratech's resolution plan to acquire the bankrupt company. The Committee of Creditors (CoC) decided against reconsidering the bid. Five other companies, including Adani Enterprises and Vedanta Group, have submitted resolution plans, with a detailed summary to determine the highest bidder.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh CRDA approves pooling 20,494 additional acres in Amaravati capital region
news.para: The Capital Region Development Authority (CRDA) has approved land pooling of 20,494 acres from seven villages. This decision was made during the 50th CRDA meeting. The government already has 54,000 acres for Amaravati. They plan to acquire 40,000 more acres. CRDA will issue a request for proposal to develop residential zones. Four convention centers will be constructed.

news.title: Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO to open on July 10
news.para: Smartworks Coworking Spaces is launching its IPO on July 10, closing on July 14, with a reduced fresh issue of Rs 445 crore and an OFS of 33.79 lakh shares. The funds will be used for capital expenditure, loan payments, and general corporate purposes. Smartworks, a leading platform for office experiences, caters to businesses of all sizes with tech-enabled campuses.

news.title: Property, water & sewer tax now unified into single bill in Prayagraj
news.para: Prayagraj Municipal Corporation is set to launch a unified billing system, consolidating property, water, and sewer taxes into a single bill for city residents. Expected to go live next week, the system aims to streamline taxation and reduce administrative overhead, following state government guidelines.

news.title: Land pooling for Indore-Pithampur Economic Corridor starts
news.para: Madhya Pradesh Industrial Development Corporation (MPIDC) has initiated land pooling for the 19.60 km Indore-Pithampur Economic Corridor, aiming to boost commercial and industrial activities. With over 250 acres already consented, the project, estimated at Rs 2,400 crore, will allocate 60% of developed land to farmers.

news.title: Delhi HC junks plea to monitor ED probe against IREO Residences
news.para: The Delhi High Court has greenlit the Enforcement Directorate's (ED) investigation into real estate firm IREO Residences, dismissing allegations of bias. Justice Manmeet Pritam Singh Arora reprimanded petitioner Gulshan Babbar for withholding crucial information and imposed a ₹1.25 lakh penalty for misleading the court.

news.title: Goa CM urges centre to relax sand extraction, sound rules
news.para: Chief Minister Pramod Sawant has requested the Union government to ease sand extraction regulations, similar to those in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, and consider allowing music beyond the 10 PM restriction to boost tourism in Goa.

news.title: Pune: Residents express concern over neglect of dilapidated buildings in Camp
news.para: Camp residents are deeply concerned about the deteriorating buildings in their area, criticizing the Pune Cantonment Board (PCB) for inaction. Despite a 2021 survey identifying over 100 dangerous properties, many structures remain hazardous. Disputes between owners and tenants, particularly regarding low rents, hinder redevelopment efforts.

news.title: Reviewing CCI order, will take appropriate legal recourse: Asian Paints
news.para: Asian Paints faces a CCI investigation for allegedly abusing its dominant market position following a complaint by Grasim Industries, which recently entered the paint sector with Birla Opus. The CCI suspects Asian Paints of exclusionary practices, potentially violating competition laws by restricting dealers from working with Grasim.

news.title: Yashwant Singh buys bungalow in South Delhi for ₹100 crore
news.para: Yashwant Singh, a member of Rajasthan's royal family, has acquired an 867-square-metre bungalow in Delhi's Golf Links for Rs 100 crore. This transaction is part of a trend of high-value property deals in the area, with Golf Links becoming a sought-after location for corporate leaders and HNIs, driving prices up due to limited availability.

news.title: Delhi consumer commission holds DLF Gayatri Developers liable for delay in housing project completion
news.para: The Delhi State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission has held DLF Gayatri Developers accountable for delaying a housing project in Andhra Pradesh. The commission ordered a refund of Rs 15 lakh, along with Rs 1.5 lakh for mental distress and legal expenses, due to the developer's failure to deliver possession as promised.

news.title: Wayanad township to be ready by December 2025: Kerala revenue minister
news.para: Revenue Minister K Rajan announced that the Elstone Estate township, housing 1,662 Mundakkai–Chooralmala disaster survivors in 410 homes, is slated for completion by December 2025. The government has allocated ₹108 crore for rehabilitation, including land acquisition, compensation, and livelihood support.
